intro: Galium sylvaticum var. matteji, commonly known as the Matteji bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
